* The main class of the Joko task manager application.

*

This class handles the user interface, task storage, and command parsing.
* It runs the main program loop where users can add, list, mark/unmark, find
* The entry point of the Joko application.

*

It initializes the user interface and storage, loads tasks, and
* enters a loop to process user commands until the "bye" command is received.
ui.showMessage("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
ui.showMessage("Please type a valid input: <mark/unmark> <task number>");
ui.showMessage("Please type a valid input: <delete> <task number>");
ui.showMessage("Sorry, I could not understand your command :(");
* Parses user input into commands for the Joko task manager application.
* Provides methods to detect command types, parse task-related commands,
* and handle index-based commands such as mark, unmark, and delete.
* Represents a parsed command from user input.
* Contains information about the command type, task description,
* deadline, event times, and task index if applicable.
/** The type of the command, e.g., "todo", "deadline", "event", "mark". */
/** The task description (for todo, deadline, event). */
/** The deadline for a Deadline task (null for other types). */
/** The start time for an Event task (null for other types). */
/** The end time for an Event task (null for other types). */
/** The index of the task for index-based commands (mark, unmark, delete). */
* Constructs a simple command (like "list" or "bye") with no arguments.
* Constructs a task command (todo, deadline, event) with details.
* @param from the start time (for Event tasks)
* @param to   the end time (for Event tasks)
public Command(String type, String desc, LocalDateTime by, String from, String to) {
* Constructs an index-based command (mark, unmark, delete).
* @param index the index of the task (0-based)
this(type, null, null, null, null, index);
private Command(String type, String desc, LocalDateTime by, String from, String to, int index) {
* Returns the command type from the user's input.
* @return a {@link Command} with the index parsed
* @throws NumberFormatException if the index is missing or invalid
public static Command parseIndexCommand(String input, String type) throws NumberFormatException {
* @param input the raw user input starting with "todo "
* @return a {@link Command} representing the todo task
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if the description is empty
public static Command parseTodo(String input) throws IllegalArgumentException {
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Todo description cannot be empty");
return new Command("todo", desc, null, null, null);
* @param input the raw user input starting with "deadline "
* @return a {@link Command} representing the deadline task
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if the format is invalid or date/time is incorrect
public static Command parseDeadline(String input) throws IllegalArgumentException {
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Deadline must have a description and /by time");
return new Command("deadline", parts[0].trim(), by, null, null);
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid date/time format. Use dd/MM/yyyy HHmm");
* @param input the raw user input starting with "event "
* @return a {@link Command} representing the event task
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if the format is invalid
public static Command parseEvent(String input) throws IllegalArgumentException {
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Event must have /from time");
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Event must have /to time");
return new Command("event", desc, null, part2[0].trim(), part2[1].trim());
* Parses the user input for the 'find' command.
* Expects the second token to be the keyword to search for.
* @param input user input split by spaces
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if no keyword is provided
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Keyword cannot be empty");
return new Command("find", keyword, null, null, null);
* Checks if the input is the exit command "bye".
* @return {@code true} if the input is "bye" (case-insensitive), {@code false} otherwise
* Checks if the input is the "list" command.
* @return {@code true} if the input is "list" (case-insensitive), {@code false} otherwise
* Handles saving and loading tasks to and from a file.
* This class provides methods to persist the {@link Task} list to a file
* and to load tasks back into memory. It supports {@link ToDo}, {@link Deadline},
/** The filename where tasks are saved. */
* Constructs a new {@code Storage} instance with the given filename.
* @param filename the file path to save and load tasks
* Saves the given list of tasks to the file.
* Each task is written in a specific format depending on its type:
* @param tasks the list of tasks to save
* The file is expected to contain tasks in the format written by {@link #saveTasks(ArrayList)}.
* If the file does not exist, an empty list is returned.
* @return an {@link ArrayList} of tasks loaded from the file
return tasks; // return empty if no file yet
* Represents a task that has a specific deadline.
* Extends the {@link Task} class and adds a {@link LocalDateTime} field
* to store the date and time by which the task should be completed.
/** The date and time by which the task must be completed. */
* Constructs a new {@code Deadline} task with the given description and deadline.
* @param desc the description of the task
* @param by   the deadline date and time for the task
* Returns the deadline of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task, including its type,
* completion status, description, and formatted deadline.
* @return a formatted string representing the deadline task
DateTimeFormatter outputFormat = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy HH:mm");
* Represents an event task that occurs within a specific time period.
* Extends the {@link Task} class and adds {@code from} and {@code to} fields
* to store the start and end times of the event.
/** The start time of the event. */
/** The end time of the event. */
* Constructs a new {@code Event} task with the given description, start time, and end time.
* @param desc the description of the event
* @param from the start time of the event
* @param to   the end time of the event
public Event(String desc, String from, String to) {
* Returns the start time of the event.
* @return the start time as a {@link String}
* Returns the end time of the event.
* @return the end time as a {@link String}
* Returns a string representation of the event task, including its type,
* completion status, description, and start/end times.
* @return a formatted string representing the event task
* Represents a basic task in the Joko task manager application.
* A task has a description and a completion status. This class serves
* as the superclass for specific types of tasks such as {@link Deadline} and {@link Event}.
/** Indicates whether the task has been completed. */
* Constructs a new {@code Task} with the given description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param desc the description of the task
* Returns whether the task is completed.
* @return {@code true} if the task is done, {@code false} otherwise
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns a string representing the completion status of the task.
* @return the status string of the task
* Sets the completion status of the task.
* @param done {@code true} to mark the task as done, {@code false} to mark it as not done
* Returns a string representation of the task, combining its status and description.
* @return a formatted string representing the task
* Represents a list of tasks and provides operations to manage them.
* This class maintains an {@link ArrayList} of {@link Task} objects and
* ensures that changes to the list are persisted using {@link Storage}.
/** The list of tasks being managed. */
/** The storage used to persist tasks. */
* Constructs a new {@code TaskList} with the given tasks and storage.
* @param tasks   the initial list of tasks
* @param storage the storage instance to save tasks to
* Adds a new task to the list and saves the updated list to storage.
* Deletes the task at the specified index and saves the updated list to storage.
* @param index the index of the task to delete
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is invalid
* Marks or unmarks the task at the specified index and saves the updated list to storage.
* @param index  the index of the task to mark/unmark
* @param isDone {@code true} to mark as done, {@code false} to mark as not done
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is invalid
public Task markTask(int index, boolean isDone) {
* Returns a list of tasks whose descriptions contain the given keyword.
* @param keyword the keyword to search for
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* @return the size of the task list
* Represents a simple to-do task without a specific date or time.
* Extends the {@link Task} class. This task type only contains a description
* Constructs a new {@code ToDo} task with the given description.
* @param desc the description of the task
* Returns a string representation of the to-do task, including its type
* @return a formatted string representing the to-do task
* Handles the user interface for the Joko task manager application.

*
  • Displaying messages related to task addition, deletion, and status changes.
* It uses {@link Scanner} to read input from the user.
* Constructs a new {@code Ui} instance and initializes the input scanner.
* Displays a welcome message along with the current tasks in the list.
* @param tasks the list of tasks to display
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("No tasks in your list yet.");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Reads a line of input from the user.
* @return the input entered by the user as a {@code String}
* Displays all tasks currently in the list.
* @param tasks the list of tasks to display
System.out.println("No tasks in your list yet.");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Displays a generic message to the user.
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been added,
* along with the total number of tasks.
* @param task the task that was added
* @param size the new total number of tasks
public void showTaskAdded(Task task, int size) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:\n  " + task);
System.out.println("Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been removed,
* along with the total number of tasks.
* @param task the task that was removed
* @param size the new total number of tasks
public void showTaskDeleted(Task task, int size) {
System.out.println(" Noted. I've removed this task:\n  " + task);
System.out.println("Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been marked or unmarked as done.
* @param task the task whose status changed
* @param isDone {@code true} if the task is marked as done, {@code false} otherwise
public void showTaskMarked(Task task, boolean isDone) {
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Displays a list of tasks that match a search query.

*

If no tasks match, a message is displayed indicating that.
* @param tasks the list of matching tasks
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
